result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: AMENDED condition - Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall not operate motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or occupational license.

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM Defendant Ricky Almestica in court and by Attorney Corey Mehlos. Atty. Matthew Nugent appears for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Wade Thompson sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Nugent, crossexam by Atty. Mehlos. Closing arguments. Court finds probable cause, binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Atty Mehols Re: Withdrawing motion To Dismiss counts 2-3 of complaint at this time. Doc for review to Clerk DK

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

1:14 PM Defendant Ricky Almestica appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran.  Attorney Adam Gerol in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court finds probable cause. Defendant will contact an attorney. State recommends cash bail $5000. Court orders $2500 cash bail w/conditions. Court finds good cause for not scheduling a preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
